answers.junior: Suppressed exceptions are secondary exceptions that occur during resource cleanup. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
answers.middle: When try-with-resources closes resources, close() exceptions are suppressed if primary exception exists. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Retrieved via getSuppressed() method.
answers.senior: Suppressed exceptions preserve all error information when both try block and resource closing throw. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Primary exception takes precedence, suppressed attached as secondary.
answers.tricky: Discuss manual exception suppression with addSuppressed(), multi-resource scenarios, and debugging implications. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
